newsitem.title: CHINA: China cancels festival celebrations for Deng.
newsitem.headline: China cancels festival celebrations for Deng.

text.p: China has cancelled most celebrations for the annual lantern festival in mourning for the death of paramount leader Deng Xiaoping, officials said on Friday.

"Out of mourning for Comrade Deng Xiaoping we have cancelled all dances and singing for the lantern festival," said one official of the Workers Organisation office at Longqingxia in Yenqing county, site of one of the biggest festivals around Beijing.

The festival that marks the end of the 15-day Chinese lunar new year celebrations is a time when Chinese string up brightly coloured lamps, traditionally in paper but now many made of plastic, in parks around the country.
Since the economic reforms launched by Deng, who died at 92 on Wednesday, have fuelled greater freedoms, Chinese celebrate with traditional folk dancing and singing.
That will not happen on Friday, officials said.
"People can come to the parks to look at the lanterns, but they should do so quietly and respectfully," the workers official said.
The annual evening television spectacular broadcast by Chinese Central Television has also been called off, television station officials said.
